definitions.definition: To put in a random order.
definitions.example: Don't forget to shuffle the cards.

definitions.definition: To change; modify the order of something.
To move in a slovenly, dragging manner; to drag or scrape the feet in walking or dancing.
definitions.example: He shuffled out of the room.

definitions.definition: To change one's position; to shift ground; to evade questions; to resort to equivocation; to prevaricate.
To use arts or expedients; to make shift.
To shove one way and the other; to push from one to another.
definitions.example: to shuffle money from hand to hand

definitions.definition: To remove or introduce by artificial confusion.
The act or motion of one who shuffles.
The noise created by something moving about.
Moving with a dragging, scraping step.
